202529Proof Use chain rule to expand I(U; (V, W)) in two ways i.e.

For \epsilon >0 and any n , we define the typical set A_{\epsilon }^{(n)} with respect to f(x) as follows:
A_{\epsilon }^{(n)}=\left \{(x_{1},x_{2},\ldots ,x_{n})\in S^{n}:\left |-\frac {1}{n}\log f(x_{1},x_{2},\ldots ,x_{n})-h(X)\right |\leq \epsilon \right \},
where f(x_{1},x_{2},\ldots ,x_{n})=\prod _{i=1}^{n}f(x_{i}) .
The volume Vol( A ) of a set A\subset \mathcal {R}^{n} is defined as \text {Vol}(A)=\int _{A}dx_{1}\,dx_{2}\,\cdots \,dx_{n}.

The typical set A_{\epsilon }^{(n)} has the following properties:
\Pr \left (A_{\epsilon }^{(n)}\right )>1-\epsilon for n sufficiently large.
\mathrm {Vol}\left (A_{\epsilon }^{(n)}\right )\leq 2^{n(h(X)+\epsilon )} for all n .
\mathrm {Vol}\left (A_{\epsilon }^{(n)}\right )\geq (1-\epsilon )2^{n(h(X)-\epsilon )} for n sufficiently large.

For, p_{i}=\int _{i\,\Delta }^{(i+1)\,\Delta }f(x)\,d x=f(x_{i})\Delta \,. We define the discrete approximation of the differential entropy as \begin {align*} H(X^{\Delta })&\coloneqq -\sum _{-\infty }^{\infty }p_{i}\log p_{i} \\ &=-\sum _{-\infty }^{\infty }f(x_{i})\Delta \log (f(x_{i})\Delta ) \\ &=-\sum \Delta f(x_{i})\log f(x_{i})-\sum f(x_{i})\Delta \log \Delta \\ &=-\sum \Delta f(x_{i})\log f(x_{i})-\log \Delta , .\end {align*}

fr:tree.fr:mainmatter: Taking \Delta = 2^{-n}, then X^{\Delta } is an "n-bit" approximation of X.
